message_1:
A telecommunications company wants to test different combinations of three factors - A, B, and C - to determine the best combination that minimizes signal interference. Each factor has two possible levels: high (+1) and low (-1). 

Using an orthogonal array, design an experiment to test all possible combinations of the three factors such that each factor is tested twice in both high and low levels. How many combinations in total will be tested?
message_2:
To design an experiment using an orthogonal array, we need to test all possible combinations of the three factors (A, B, and C) with each factor having two levels (high and low). Since there are three factors and each factor has two levels, there will be 2^3 = 8 combinations in total. Here are the combinations:

1. A(-1), B(-1), C(-1)
2. A(-1), B(-1), C(+1)
3. A(-1), B(+1), C(-1)
4. A(-1), B(+1), C(+1)
5. A(+1), B(-1), C(-1)
6. A(+1), B(-1), C(+1)
7. A(+1), B(+1), C(-1)
8. A(+1), B(+1), C(+1)

These 8 combinations will be tested in the experiment.
